intro: Echites microphyllus, commonly known as the small-leaved echites, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or inland regions. Echites microphyllus is adapted to withstand drought and salt spray, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
